ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Writing & registering a DecideRule
ygData.msgSnippet: The best approach is to pick a similar DecideRule and use it as a model. The method for making it appear in the web UI varies between 1.14.x and 2.0.x. In

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Writing & registering a DecideRule
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=K3GNNrc9nJgD6Q3Rf6-GHgiPjBoZI2xshZ3s67LoccXE
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The best approach is to pick a similar DecideRule and use it as a model.

The method for making it appear in the web UI varies between 1.14.x and 
2.0.x.

In 1.14.x, it involves making sure a 'DecideRule.options' file with your 
new class(es) is found on the classpath.  Here are two old threads with 
more info:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/4142
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/4578

A similar procedure but with a '[classname].subclasses' file applies in 
2.0.x and is mentioned here:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/5268

(Also in 2.0, you can type the fully-qualified name of any class on the 
classpath to add it in the web UI.)

The approach may change slightly again in 2.2 and beyond, but we will 
definitely maintain the ability to type the full name of any desired 
class to include it in the configuration.

- Gordon @ IA

>

> and install a custom DecideRule in Heritrix.  Can somebody point me to some information on 
> this?  I'd greatly appreciate it.
>
